Name: mixed mineral dust pneumoconiosis
Definition: An interstitial lung disease that is caused by the inhalation of dust.

Name: asbestosis
Definition: A pneumoconiosis caused by inhalation and retention of asbestos fibers.

Name: baritosis
Definition: A pneumoconiosis caused by inhalation and retention of asbestos fibers.

Name: berylliosis
Definition: A pneumoconiosis that involves allergic response located_in lungs caused by inhalation of beryllium compounds.

Name: byssinosis
Definition: A pneumoconiosis that involves allergic response located_in lungs caused by inhalation of beryllium compounds.

Name: anthracosilicosis
Definition: A pneumoconiosis that involves allergic response located_in lungs caused by inhalation of beryllium compounds.

Name: silicosis
Definition: A pneumoconiosis that is an inflammation and scarring of the uper lobes of the lungs causing nodular lesions resulting from inhalation of silica

Name: Caplan's syndrome
Definition: A pneumoconiosis that results_in humans that also have rheumatoid arthritis.

Name: anthracosis
Definition: A pneumoconiosis that results_in humans that also have rheumatoid arthritis.

Name: siderosis
Definition: A pneumoconiosis that results_in humans that also have rheumatoid arthritis.

Name: pneumoconiosis due to talc
Definition: A pneumoconiosis that results_in humans that also have rheumatoid arthritis.

Name: slate pneumoconiosis
Definition: A pneumoconiosis that results_in humans that also have rheumatoid arthritis.

Name: kaolin pneumoconiosis
Definition: A pneumoconiosis that results_in humans that also have rheumatoid arthritis.

Name: obsolete disorder of optic chiasm due to vascular disorder
Definition: A pneumoconiosis that results_in humans that also have rheumatoid arthritis.
Synonym: disorder of optic chiasm associated with vascular disorder

Name: obsolete craniofacial abnormality
Definition: A pneumoconiosis that results_in humans that also have rheumatoid arthritis.
Synonym: Skull or face bone anomaly NOS (disorder)
